content.en: Groundwater optimization: Scientists have been exploring different algorithms to address various research questions related to groundwater flow and parameter estimation. These algorithms, such as gradient, Gauss-Newton, and full Newton algorithms, are used to estimate groundwater flow parameters under uncertainty. Other algorithms, like the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm and two-stage feedback optimization, are compared to identify effective approaches for groundwater flow and transport parameter identification. These advancements in algorithmic techniques are improving groundwater flow models, reducing uncertainty, and optimizing monitoring networks.
content.da: Optimering af grundvand: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige algoritmer for at adressere forskellige forskningsspørgsmål relateret til grundvandets strømning og parameterestimation. Disse algoritmer, såsom gradient, Gauss-Newton og fuld Newton algoritmer, bruges til at estimere grundvandets strømningsparametre under usikkerhed. Andre algoritmer, som Levenberg-Marquardt algoritmen og to-trins feedback optimering, sammenlignes for at identificere effektive tilgange til identificering af grundvandets strømning og transportparametre. Disse fremskridt inden for algoritmiske teknikker forbedrer grundvandsmodeller, reducerer usikkerhed og optimerer overvågningsnetværk.
